algorithm_technique: Floyd-Warshall algorithm for all-pairs shortest paths
problem_summary_simple: Find the city with the fewest reachable neighbors within a distance threshold.
problem_summary_technical: Computes all-pairs shortest paths using Floyd-Warshall, then counts reachable neighbors within the threshold for each city.
key_insights: The problem requires finding shortest paths between all pairs of cities.
Floyd-Warshall is suitable for dense graphs or when all-pairs shortest paths are needed.
After computing distances, iterate through each city to count neighbors within the threshold.
